name: NIST 800-53
fullName: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5 — Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems and Organizations
governingBody: NIST (National Institute of Standards and Technology)
description: NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 provides a comprehensive catalog of security and privacy controls for federal information systems and organizations. It serves as the foundational control framework for FISMA compliance, FedRAMP authorization, and is widely adopted across government and private sectors. The framework covers 20 control families spanning management, operational, and technical safeguards.

certificationDetails.assessor: 3PAO for FedRAMP; Agency ATO authority for FISMA
certificationDetails.typicalCost: $50,000 - $500,000+ (depends on system complexity and authorization type)
certificationDetails.certificationBody: Authorizing Official (AO) within sponsoring Federal Agency; FedRAMP PMO for cloud services

lifecycle.name: Categorize
lifecycle.description: Categorize the information system and the information processed, stored, and transmitted based on FIPS 199 impact levels (Low, Moderate, High).

lifecycle.name: Select
lifecycle.description: Select an initial set of controls (baseline) for the system based on its categorization and tailor as needed.
keyActivities: Tailor controls based on risk assessment
Supplement with additional controls as needed

lifecycle.name: Implement
lifecycle.description: Implement the selected security and privacy controls and document how they are deployed within the system and operating environment.

lifecycle.name: Assess
lifecycle.description: Assess the security and privacy controls to determine if they are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcomes.

lifecycle.name: Authorize
lifecycle.description: Authorize the system based on the determination that the risk to organizational operations and assets is acceptable.

lifecycle.name: Monitor
lifecycle.description: Continuously monitor the security and privacy controls, report on system security posture, and respond to changes in risk.

breachNotification.timeframe: 1 hour for major incidents to CISA; agency-specific timelines per OMB M-24-04
breachNotification.threshold: Any incident involving confirmed or suspected unauthorized access to PII or sensitive government information
